meanings.definition: A person or thing that terminates or ends something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was the terminator of our fun when she ended recess early.
meanings.sent2: The judge acted as the terminator of the trial by delivering the final verdict.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock became the terminator of my peaceful sleep every morning.
meanings.sent4: The storm was the terminator of our picnic plans, forcing us to cancel.
meanings.sent5: The deadline for the project was the terminator of our procrastination, pushing us to work hard.

meanings.definition: A character in a science fiction movie who is a robot designed to kill humans.
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the terminator relentlessly pursued the main characters.
meanings.sent2: The terminator's mission was to eliminate the target at all costs.
meanings.sent3: The terminator robot accidentally spilled coffee on itself, causing a short circuit.
meanings.sent4: The terminator's red glowing eyes struck fear into the hearts of the survivors.
meanings.sent5: The terminator's metallic hand was a cold reminder of its inhuman nature.

meanings.definition: A device that marks the end of a line or series.
meanings.sent1: The terminator on the document indicated the conclusion of the text.
meanings.sent2: The terminator on the train track signaled the end of the line.
meanings.sent3: The terminator on the assembly line stopped the conveyor belt automatically.
meanings.sent4: The terminator on the cable marked the final connection point.
meanings.sent5: The terminator on the computer cable prevented signal interference at the end.
